titleStmt.title: The Story of a Fierce Bad Rabbit
story of a fierce bad rabbit
titleStmt.author: Beatrix Potter

editionStmt.p: In wallet binding with title page on inside; col. illustrations and text printed on recto of 1 long continuous strip. Ornamental green border on each page. Col. ill. mounted on front flap of binding.

biblFull.extent: 1 folded sheet ([28] p.) : col. ill. ; 12 x 248 cm. folded to 12 x 10 cm.

publicationStmt.idno: Source copy consulted: UVA, Alderman Library, Department of Special Collections, call no: PZ 10.3 .P47 Stf 1910z

projectDesc.p: Prepared for the University of Virginia Library Electronic Text Center.

editorialDecl.p: All unambiguous end-of-line hyphens have been removed, and the trailing part of a word has been joined to the preceding line.
Some keywords in the header are a local Electronic Text Center scheme to aid in establishing analytical groupings.

respStmt.name: Matthew Gibson, The Electronic Text Center

change.item: Added Frederick Warne's copyright emendation regarding European usage

respStmt.name: Matthew Gibson, The Electronic Text Center

change.item: Converted SGML to XML and/or corrected tagging.

respStmt.name: Ethan Gruber, University of Virginia Library

change.item: Converted XML markup from TEI Lite to uva-dl-tei (TEI P4 with local customizations).

respStmt.name: Greg Murray, University of Virginia Library

change.item: Programmatically updated TEI header markup (but not header content) for minimal compliance with current QA requirements.

respStmt.name: Scholarly Resources, University of Virginia Library

change.item: Added and/or replaced the digital images accompanying the electronic text. Scanning of exterior and interior (ie. pages) of item was done only for items found in the University of Virginia Special Collections Library.

Booklet:
THE STORY OF
MISS MOPPET

The Story of
A Fierce Bad
Rabbit
titlePage.byline:

div1.head:
The Story of
A Fierce Bad
Rabbit
div1.p: Image of the Fierce Bad Rabbit
Image of Text

THIS is a fierce bad
Rabbit; look at his
savage whiskers, and his
claws, and his turned-up
tail.
Image of the good rabbit gnawing on a carrot and sitting on a bench. The fierce bad rabbit is coming up behind him.
Image of Text

THIS is a nice gentle
Rabbit. His mother
has given him a carrot.
Image fierce bad rabbit taking the carrot from the nice good rabbit.
Image of Text

THE bad Rabbit would
like some carrot.
Image of Fierce Bad Rabbit taking the carrot and pushing the nice good rabbit off of the bench with his paw.
Image of Text

HE doesn't say "Please.''
He takes it!
Image of the Fierce Bad Rabbit biting and clawing the nice good rabbit.
Image of Text

AND he scratches the good
Rabbit very badly.
Image of nice good rabbit huddled under a tree and the Fierce Bad Rabbit is in the background eating the carrot on the bench.
Image of Text

THE good Rabbit creeps
away, and hides in a
hole. It feels sad.
Image of the great white hunter with gun, satchel, and a red nose.
Image of Text

THIS is a man with a
gun.
Image of hunter as he sees the fierce bad rabbit sitting on the bench eating his carrot. The hunter lowers his gun to fire!
Image of Text

HE sees something sitting
on a bench. He thinks
it is a very funny bird!
Image of the Fierce Bad Rabbit eating his carrot and not suspecting the mighty hunter at all!
Image of Text

HE comes creeping up
behind the trees.
Image hunter shooting at the Fierce Bad Rabbit and a whirl of gunsmoke infuses the air around the barrel.
Image of Text

AND then he shoots—
BANG!
In a tornado of chaos, rabbit ears, the rabbit's tail and the carrot are strewn about.
Image of Text
THIS is what happens—
The hunter runs upon the bench only to find the Fierce Bad Rabbit's Tail and carrot.
Image of Text

BUT this is all he finds
on the bench, when he
rushes up with his gun.
Image of the nice good rabbit coming out from under the tree hole. The hunter is in the background.
Image of Text

The good Rabbit
peeps out of its hole . . .
Image of the Fierce Bad Rabbit running without his tail!!!
Image of Text

AND it sees the bad Rabbit
tearing past—without
any tail or whiskers!
Image of End Paper with Special Collections call number card: Gift of Clifford Siegel

FREDERICK
WARNE & Co
New York
& London.
